Key Arguments: The legislation will stifle freedom of speech.
Individuals have the right to collect information and determine truth without government interference.
Allowing ACMA to decide harmful content is an attack on free speech.
The threat of fines will lead tech companies to censor content that doesn't align with the government narrative.
Government control over information is a greater threat to democracy and society than differing opinions.
The exemption of government and media from the legislation indicates a lack of accountability.
Notable Quotes: Official control of the narrative of online content by Government via ACMA is a very bad thing.
It is an outrageous attack on free speech to allow ACMA to decide what online content constitutes harm.
The best way to combat misinformation is always free and open debate, NOT censorship!
